content: Sergey Brin, co-founder of Google and Alphabet Inc., began his graduate studies in computer science at the Stanford School of Engineering in 1993.
Sergey Brin met Larry Page during his second year of graduate studies at Stanford, and together they developed PageRank, an algorithm later renamed Google.
What began as a Stanford research project debuted as a company in 1998.

Sergey Brin returned to Stanford campus on December 7 for the closing event of Stanford Engineeringâ€™s centennial year, engaging in a conversation with Stanford President Jonathan Levin and Dean Jennifer Widom.
